reviews.text: I have been staying at Drei Loewen since 1953 and it is the only place I will stay while in Munich. I have watched many employees come and go, but the heart is still in the hotel. I come to Munich several times a year and always look forward to the Drei Loewen Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Memories

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in July of last year and I found it remarkable. The buffet breakfast was hard to beat with a great selection of meats, teas,breads etc. The rooms were very tastefully decorated and they were cleaned very well also. The staff were also great-efficient yet friendly. The area seems to be the city's red light district but I found it remarkably quiet . This is possibly the best hotel to stay in if you want to be close to Munich's Central Station and the shoopping areas also.
reviews.title: Great location for Hbf.
Great location, a 1 block walk from train station
reviews.text: Stayed here in February 2005 and enjoyed this hotel. The beds were comfortable which is always important for me! However, the walls were thin and I can imagine that during a festival there could potentially be noise issues not only in the hallways but outside the hotel. Luckily for us, we weren't bothered by noisy and inconsiderate guests! The breakfast was incredible, down to the frothy hot chocolate, omelettes prepared to order and the huge selection of pastries, meats, and cheeses. Just a stunning and fabulous way to fill up for the day! I must also say that the service was excellent. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready. We said we were happy to wait so they called housekeeping, got them to do it up and got us coffee and tea while we waited. Each and every time we passed a member of staff they greeted us. On the way out, a staff member was in the small elevator (there is only 1) and noticing our luggage, got out and allowed us to go down so we wouldn't have to wait.

reviews.title: Would stay there again
reviews.text: We stayed for about a week visiting our son who was studying in Munich.

reviews.title: Three Lions
reviews.text: The hotel is in a very good location near Haptbahnof to get to the sites in and near Munich using public transportation. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was very helpful and polite. Althought it was near a busy area, the interior was quiet.

reviews.title: Not too bad.
reviews.text: Having stayed here in June, (with friends, I'd already booked accomodation here for August), we discovered that the hotels air conditioning didn't work. It was very hot in June, and promptly I sent an email when I got home to make sure it would be working for August when I returned. I received an email with assured me the air conditioning was fixed. However, it was not fixed! The temperatures were fortunately lower in August, however windows had to be opened which required ear plugs to be worn as there was a lot of street noise, ambulances, etc. On the positive side, the breakfast was fantastic, an adequate room (albeit hot inside), and the staff were very helpful.

reviews.title: Superb hotel
reviews.text: stayed here December 2002, great location, friendly helpful staff. Well appointed rooms

reviews.title: Vacation in Munich
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Drei Lowen for 7 nights. We had a great time. The staff was fantastic, the rooms were nicely decorated and very roomy and the location is superb. It is close to the railway station and easy walking distance to many attractions.I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone looking to stay in Munich. I can't wait to go back....

reviews.title: Bratwurst and Applewine at the christmas market
reviews.text: Everyone has to go to the christmas market in munich it was GREAT!!! We stayed at the hotel drei lowen which is perfectly located about a half a block from the main ttrain station.. The staff was AWESOME and the room was great.. our train wasent leaving for about three hours past our check out .. the hotel was kind enough to watch our bags while we went back to the market.. we still had time to spare so we watched a soccer game<munich vs. Berlin> with the staff in the lobby ... GO Bayern-munich!!!!

reviews.title: A hotel that needs renovation
reviews.text: This hotel is past its prime and needs major renovation to its plumbing. The staff is also not very attentive and when a fight occurred in the room adjacent to our, no staff was available to handle the situation. When I reported it to hotel management in the next day, they were very sorry for the incident but did nothing to the occupants. The staff shuts down the elevator during room cleaning which makes the stairs the only means of travel which is difficult for someone that is disabled.

reviews.title: I'd stay again
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is also not the best as it is frequented by numerous men who crowd around the entrance and we witnessed several instances of pickpockets working the area.

reviews.title: An excellent choice
reviews.text: I would not stay at this hotel again on my travels to Munich.

reviews.title: Great Location, Good Hotel
reviews.text: Great location and very helpful staff. No A/C, but they gave us a fan which did the trick. The room was a little small for three, but we weren't there to hang out in the hotel.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.text: I booked this hotel online for a group of eight family members - 4 double rooms. The lady at the front desk greeted us so pleasantly and was VERY helpful...probably the best service we received on our entire 2-wk trip through 4 countries.

The room was comfortable and clean. On the small side but there were only two of us. Bathroom was clean but needed a little updating. About 3 blocks from the train station. This hotel is also within stumbling distance (we proved it!) of Oktoberfest. Negatives: Parking was not included and was really expensive at a nearby garage, our room wasn't ready when we arrived one hour after check in time (we waited about 15 minutes), elevators are very small and slow (we ended up carrying our bags down the stairs)
reviews.title: Comfortable and Close to Oktoberfest and Train Station

reviews.text: This place isn't very nice, particularly for the money. As seemingly the last centrally located double room available in Munich on a Saturday during Oktoberfest, I paid waaaay too much for this place so that will color my review, naturally.
reviews.title: Definitely not recommended

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located and while the neighborhood appears borderline seedy I don't think it's anything to worry about. The building looks like it could be a communist construction from Eastern Europe on the outside and the interior isn't much better. Rooms are average-sized (for Europe, small by US standards) and plainly furnished. The carpet in my room was filthy but otherwise the hotel seemed clean enough.
reviews.title: Great value for money
Hot stuff, Good Location
reviews.text: My main complaint is that the hotel tried to put us in an already occupied room (unmade bed, full closets, luggage everywhere) and thought nothing of it. I have no idea if they were running some sort of scam, were monumentally obtuse, or what, but I had to raise hell to get a properly made up, unoccupied room. This absurd waste of my time alone is enough to get this place a 1 star review in my book, in the absence of other mitigating factors.

My wife and I spent 7 nights here. Though double room was little bit small for two person, it was comportable for traveler. It's very near to central station and subway. The room was well done with great air conditioning, nice bathroom (with large bath!) and very large thick towels. The staff was helpful and courteous. Hot Breakfast was great, too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
